intro: Horkelia glandulosa, commonly known as the sticky horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, glandular leaves that are covered in fine, sticky hairs. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. Horkelia glandulosa is often found in regions with cool, moist climates and is adapted to thrive in disturbed or arid environments.
